data.title: Went For My Birthday
data.text: My fiancé made a reservation for us at Side By Side for my birthday. It was a Tuesday and although we didn't necessarily need it, I would recommend it for busier days. We were seated right away, the booth was spacious but not too much, and very comfy. The drink choices were great, they had a large selection of everything. I had the duck and my fiancé had the lamb, both were perfect! The deserts were delightful as well. It may be a little pricier than other places around but I thought it was fine. We got our picture taken by the staff to bring home with us too. Loved it!

data.title: Fantastic meal and friendly service
data.text: We dropped off our son at the University and we decided to eat downtown. The restaurant is attached to the new Embassy Suites Hotel on College Ave. The atmosphere in the restaurant is very comforting and it is nicely decorated. The bar is stocked with high end spirits, local brews as well as the norm. The food was fast, hot and absolutely fantastic. The menu has fresh gulf seafood, game and fine selection of cheese's. I had the duck for dinner and it was out of this world, highly recommend it. Then the deserts came, the berry bread pudding was outstanding. The server we had (Kyle) did a great job and I recommend you ask for him. We will definitely be coming back to this restaurant for a fine meal and great service.

data.title: AN HOUR AND A HALF FOR OUR MEAL!!!!!! NOT AGAIN!!!
data.text: Ok, what is up with the horrible service at this restaurant??? We have been here once before and the service was really bad then, but we thought it was because the restaurant had just opened.  Now its over one year later and the service is even worse.  It would be different if the food was worth the wait, but unfortunately this hasn't been the case. There is NOTHING at this place worth waiting over an hour for and then another hour to get the check!!! The hostess was very rude upon our arrival, even though we had reservations, she told us we would have to wait! Well, there were several tables unoccupied, but we still had to wait way past our reservation time. Then upon seating until the time our food was brought to our table was an hour and a half!!!!  We were full of water and iced tea before food was insight!  We contemplated many times just getting up and leaving. We noticed all the tables around us were  waiting long times for their food also. Many unhappy diners at this restaurant.  The servers are all over the place, forgetting to bring starters.  Don't try and order a  cocktail refill, it will take even longer to get it.  There is such a breakdown in the front of the house communication with the kitchen.  Do you blame the server or blame the kitchen?? Our decision is to forego this place in the future.  There are many other great places in town to eat, this place is not a place we will go to again.  We did give it a shot and both times a huge let down.  Don't waste your time at this place. From what I understand, the chef is known to have bad service at his restaurants.  Breakdown in communication!!

data.title: Game Day Weekend
data.text: We love the food and drinks! Friendly staff who is always accommodating.  Paige is one of my favorite people to see when we walk in the restaurant.

data.title: Flavorful
data.text: My husband and I dined at the establishment on 08/20/16. The ambience  was nice. The wait staff was attentive and they did a wonderful job of ensuring our glasses stayed full. We had the market soup for the appetizer and the catch of the day as our entrées. The market soup reminded me of a chicken tortilla soup without the chips. It was earthy, spicy, and flavorful. The catch of the day at market price was a red fish grilled with fried green tomatoes accented with lump crab meat! This was a flavorful meal.

data.title: Birthday Dinner
data.text: We went to Side By Side for my husband's birthday dinner.  We have been there 3 times, now.  The service was very well paced.  Our entrees were excellently prepared and presented.  It IS pricey to some people, but we expect that for this level of service and food preparation.  A very nice meal, including dessert.  We will return.  (Complimentary Valet Parking, by the way -- only need to consider a gratuity.)

data.title: Over Priced
data.text: Couldn't wait for this place to open at the Embassy Suites hotel as we heard so many great things about the chef. Nice atmosphere in a brand new hotel, much needed in Tuscaloosa. But the service is OK as is the food. You will pay for eating in a nice hotel, that's about it. I see this place as more of a convenience for people traveling on business who are staying at the hotel, not for the typical Tuscaloosian looking for a place to dine on a night out.

data.title: Exceptional selections of each course meal!
data.text: We have been there several times and love the food, offering differ foods for each season. Freshness and exceptional taste whatever you decide.

data.title: Great Oysters on Thursdays
data.text:
I am really not very impressed by this restaurant which is in a fantastic hotel.  I have been there 3 times and the food was average especially for the price you pay.  I had the New York Strip steak and everything was too salty and the Sweet Potatoes was way under cooked.  The crispy chicken skin could be a nice touch but it is too salty.
You can see there is a lot of potential but I think they are trying too hard to be different with their food and not getting the basics right.  The service is great though and very helpful.
Thursday night Oyster Special on the other hand is absolutely great and I will go there again this week for that.  A dollar a oyster with a lovely touch and glass of Chardonnay.

data.title: Delicious Lunch in a Beautiful Setting
data.text:
I took a friend to lunch at The Side by Side for her birthday celebation The hotel lobby is very inviting and well decorated, so that in itself is a treat. The restaurant is just off the lobby and is equally impressive in its decor. It does offer a lunch menu which was a bit pricey, but not overly so in regard to other downtown Tuscaloosa restaurants. We were seated by the windows which offered a sunny and beautiful atmosphere for our special occasion, which made the celebration feel more special. We ordered the burgers. We both commented that our meal was truly delicious and that is coming from two people who are picky about their meals! I, along with my friend, were quite pleased with our choice of restaurant. 

in regard to the staff, I will say our waiter was nice, but just a bit stiff. He was almost insistent that he box my remaining meal himself (which I personally do not care for due to possible germs) to go. He even said to not let the manager see that he was not boxing the my meal. I found that a bit insulting. People should have rights of how they want their food handled once it has been brought to their table. That was the only part of my experience that was a bit off for me.

I will definitely go back, especially if I am looking for a place for various special occasions. I think it would also be a lot of fun to go during football season. I highly recommend trying the restaurant if you have not already.

data.title: Disappointed Graduation Dinner
data.text: After months of planning and confirmations for a graduation celebration dinner, I was completely disappointed in our seating arrangements and service. The restaurant manager was incredibly rude when approached about the situation. Go somewhere else in Tuscaloosa for special occasions!!

data.title: Okay, but it could have been a lot better
data.text: We made reservations but the place was nearly empty on a Friday at 7:30.  The wait staff was sparse and unfamiliar with the food.  The food lacked imagination and any sort of culinary flair.  The only exception were the killer rabbit tamales appetizer.  The next time I go this is all I will order.

data.title: ate there 2 days in a row...embarassing, but true
data.text: we were there in april and enjoyed it and liked it even more this time. the ravioli appetizer was delicious as was the fish special. the next day we were hungry for a snack around 4 and had the cheese platter. my daughter and i don't like ham which comes on the cheese plate so they made it without and the cheese selection was perfect. both times the waitresses were really nice and accommodating. we will most definitely go back.

data.title: Fine dining in Tuscaloosa
data.text: I love Side by Side. It is expensive for Tuscaloosa but all of the ingredients are locally sourced and very fresh. It is a quaint charming place and one of the nicest places for dinner in the area.  They have a wonderful bar and can accommodate groups. The seafood is outstanding. I have been at least 6 times in the less than a year they have been open and I live 800 miles away. I try to visit  every time I am in Tuscaloosa.

data.title: Too Expensive
data.text: Nice atmosphere. Good service. Was not blown away by the food. For the prices they charge I expected more. Had the duck which was good but the mushrooms with it were over done and tasted like burnt pepper.  Did seem a little slow with the food.  It was overall a great place to celebrate graduation but I would not go out of my way to go back.

data.title: Nice atmosphere; horrible menu
data.text: It's been a year since I dined, but I clearly recalled having difficulty deciding on what to order because there was NOTHING that even sounded appealing! I settled on a lamb dish that had a horrible smell as it was brought to table! Sadly the taste matched the odor!

data.title: Overpriced restaurant in a very nice hotel
data.text: Why stop here when Tuscaloosa offers at least three very good restaurants within a fifty yard walk?  Despite warnings of friends we tried SBS and were underwhelmed.  The place is pretty but the waitress wouldn't make it in a local meat and three, much less a good restaurant.  The food was very overpriced and none of the three members of our party had a delicious dish in any course from appetizer through dessert.  We have attended two banquet functions at the hotel and recommend that SBS fire its chef and hire the hotel's banquet chef.

data.title: Group lunch
data.text: Tasty dishes.  Short menu    Very lovely restaurant.  Fresh fish was ok.  Everyone in the group was satisfied with selection.  Wait staff appear to be in a learning curve

data.title: Great for lunch or special dinner nights
data.text: This is the best new restaurant to come to Tuscaloosa in a long while.  The food is gorgeous, and the menu has just enough southern attitude and lots of divine-sounding options.  The good thing is the product follows through with the descriptions.  The fried okra can't be missed and the vegetable plate is one of the most amazing collections to be found.  Seasonality, quality, pretty surroundings (especially in the "front window" room.  We can't wait to go back when we are next in town.

data.title: Good food but limited menu
data.text: In T-town there are few finer diner options than in most places.  Side by Side is one of them. The food is very good and the service was good too. But there was a very limited menu.  The menus is primarily upscale southern cuisine.  With today's nutritional concerns, you need to have more healthier choices (fish, chicken, some without heavy sauces or extravagant preparations).  Having said that, we had a very good meal.  Almost everyone had the chicken, which was excellent.
